page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Port Glasgow grew from the fishing hamlet of Newark.A{castle},still standing,was built in the l5th century by the Maxwells,the local lairds.This is the oldest building in Port Glasgow. As a{shipbuilding}town Port Glasgow has several "firsts".Its Dry Dock,closed in l966, was designed by James Watt and built in l762.This was the first in Scotland.In l812 the "Comet",constructed on the Clyde was the first{steamship}to sail up the Clyde.A replica of the "Comet" now stands across from the new Town Hall. When Coronation Park opened to the public in l937 people used this for {recreation.} Queen Elizabeth and Prince Philip visited Port Glasgow on 7th July 1958.
